A 4 x 3 transformation matrix.

DzMatrix3 & DzMatrix3::operator*= ( float  c  ) 

Multiplies this matrix by a scalar. Matrix multiplication with a scalar is commutative, as opposed to multiplication of two matrices. This means, that given three matrices A, B, and C and a scalar s, the following is true:

AB(Cs) = A(Bs)C = (As)BC

This is also true of matrix / vector / scalar multiplication:

(Mv)s = M(vs) = (Ms)v

Returns:
A reference to this matrix.
DzMatrix3 DzMatrix3::operator+ ( const DzMatrix3 &  m  )  const

Adds the given matrix to this matrix

Parameters:
m The matrix to add with this matrix
Returns:
the result of the added matrices
DzMatrix3 & DzMatrix3::operator+= ( const DzMatrix3 &  m  ) 

Adds the given matrix to this matrix. Matrix addition is performed component-wise, like vector addition. Matrix addition is left and right distributive. This means that given three matrices A, B, and C, the following are true:

AB + AC = A(B + C) AB + CB = (A + C)B

This is also true of matrix / vector multiplication:

Av + Bv = (A + B)v

Returns:
A reference to this matrix
DzMatrix3 DzMatrix3::operator- ( const DzMatrix3 &  m  )  const

Subtracts the given matrix from this matrix

Parameters:
m The matrix to subtract from this matrix
Returns:
the result of the subtraction
DzMatrix3 & DzMatrix3::operator-= ( const DzMatrix3 &  m  ) 

Subtracts the given matrix from this matrix. Matrix subtraction is performed component-wise, like vector subtraction. Matrix subtraction is left and right distributive. This means that given three matrices A, B, and C, the following are true:

AB - AC = A(B - C) AB - CB = (A - C)B

This is also true of matrix / vector multiplication:

Av - Bv = (A - B)v

Returns:
A reference to this matrix

Sets the value of this matrix from another matrix.

Returns:
A reference to this matrix.
